Mike Schwartz wrote:
> hi,
> 
> I notice the recover.gz file occasionally has entries in an Fe line without 
> any predecessor F+ line.  I had thought there would always be an F+ line 
> for any URL before it would show up in an Fe line -- basically, you 
> discover and add a URL to the frontier before you ever emit/crawl it.  Am I 
> misunderstanding this?
> 
> I ask because the RecoveryLogMapper class I contributed recently makes the 
> assumption noted above, so when it gets an Fe without a predecessory F+ 
> line it throws an Exception to indicate that situation wasn't expeceted.

Hi, Mike.

Your assumption was correct: there should always be an 'F+' (add to Frontier)
before an 'Fe' (emit for crawl-try).

Can you easily reproduce the case where there is an 'Fe' with no preceding
'F+', or is it a rare occurence in large/long crawls?

Can you excerpt out all the recovery-log lines pertaining the the URI in
question, as well as any crawl.log lines for the same URI, to see if
that sheds any light on what's happening?

- Gordon @ IA
